metadata.title: CVE-2020-35498 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in openvswitch. A limitation in theimplementation of userspace packet parsing can allow a malicious user tosend a specially crafted packet causing the resulting megaflow in thekernel to be too wide, potentially causing a denial of service. The highestthreat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openvswitch-common - 2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
openvswitch-ipsec - 2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
openvswitch-pki - 2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
openvswitch-switch - 2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
openvswitch-switch-dpdk - 2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
openvswitch-test - 2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
openvswitch-testcontroller - 2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
openvswitch-vtep - 2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
ovn-central - 2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
ovn-common - 2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
ovn-host - 2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
python-openvswitch - 2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openvswitch package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5.9-0ubuntu0.16.04.3').
